intro: Alyxia cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure at the base. Alyxia cuspidata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
